news.title: Garda pleads guilty to punching his daughter in the face in ‘most cruel' assault
news.summary: A garda punched his daughter in the face in a “most cruel” assault after she came home from a night out at a concert with her family.

news.title: Wealthy US businessman sues Irish equestrian centre over ownership of valuable horse
news.summary: A wealthy Greek-American entrepreneur is suing an Irish equestrian centre and its proprietor over the ownership of a valuable horse.

news.title: Taxi drivers suspend six-day protest in Dublin pending outcome of government talks
news.summary: Taxi drivers have confirmed that they are suspending further escalation of protest action pending the outcome of a meeting at Government Buildings scheduled for next week.

news.title: World Cup 2026 draw: Who might lie in wait if Ireland can navigate play-offs?
news.summary: The draw for the 2026 World Cup, which will be held in the USA, Canada and Mexico, takes place this evening at the Kennedy Centre in Washington, DC.

news.title: Price rises, cinemas closing and a blow to Sky — three big questions for Irish viewers from $83bn Netflix takeover of Warner Brothers
news.summary: There are three big questions for Irish TV and cinema fans from Netflix’s putative buyout of Warner Brothers for $82.7bn (€71bn).

news.title: With direct flights and a warm welcome, could Canada be the new US for Irish visitors?
news.summary: A journey is best measured in friends, rather than miles, as travel writer Tim Cahill said. As a Pacific Northwest writer who frequently travels to Canada, I couldn’t agree more.

news.title: Ray O’Donoghue: With just four thefts a day and every stabbing making the news, Dublin is hardly a crime-ridden Gotham City
news.summary: When I began work as Dublin city’s night-time adviser 18 months ago, the city was weighed down by a negative narrative. It wasn’t long after the November riots, a low point that left many wondering what had happened to our capital after dark.

news.title: Hugh Wallace ‘lived deeply and left his mark unmistakably’, mourners told during funeral
news.summary: Award-winning architect Hugh Wallace has been described as “honest, passionate and deeply human” during his funeral at St Patrick’s Cathedral in Dublin.

news.title: ‘I am still the elected president’ – Sepp Blatter eviscerates Gianni Infantino over Ronaldo, Trump and Saudi Arabia
news.summary: Sepp Blatter can no longer bring himself to say Gianni Infantino's name. The Swiss administrator ran Fifa from 1998 to 2015 until he left amid corruption scandal.

news.title: Fred Logue: Judicial reviews are not the enemy of progress — they are a vital safeguard
news.summary: Judicial review is a way for ordinary people to ensure that laws protecting their homes, communities and the environment are enforced.
